H0.text: Nitrogen oxides are formed when nitrogen and oxygen combine at high temperatures.

H1.text: Hydrocarbons are formed when nitrogen and oxygen combine at high temperatures.

H2.text: Nitric acid forms when nitrogen and oxygen combine at high temperatures.

H3.text: Calcium oxides are the compounds that form when nitrogen and oxygen combine at high temperatures.

A4.text: At high temperatures, oxygen and nitrogen undergo an endothermic reaction producing various oxides of nitrogen.

A5.text: NO2 is further oxidized in the gas phase during daytime by reaction with OH (+M) â†’ HNO3 (+M).
